title: MVP: improve run UX (require --, print chosen port)
description: Make `freeport run` require `--` to avoid flag ambiguity; print the chosen port (stderr) before launching; keep lockfile held for lifetime of child.
acceptance_criteria: `freeport run -- echo $PORT` works; missing `--` errors; chosen port is printed once.
close_reason: Require -- for run and print chosen port to stderr

title: MVP: add check command (exit codes)
description: Add a small primitive command for automation: `freeport check PORT` prints minimal info and exits 0 if free, 1 if in-use, 2 on error. This keeps `who` human-friendly while giving agents a reliable boolean.
acceptance_criteria: `freeport check 3000` exits 0 when free, 1 when a TCP listener exists, and supports --json.
close_reason: Added check command with exit codes and JSON output

title: MVP: add README with install/build/usage
description: Add a top-level README covering what Freeport is (v0.1 no-daemon), quick install/build steps, and examples for list/who/kill/pick/run (+ JSON examples).
acceptance_criteria: README exists at repo root and matches current CLI flags.
close_reason: Added README with scope, build, and CLI examples

title: MVP: improve kill safety semantics + tests
description: Confirm and test behavior: refuse non-owned processes unless --force; TERM then optional SIGKILL escalation; deterministic output and exit codes when nothing is listening.
acceptance_criteria: Tests cover signal parsing + ownership guard; manual sanity on macOS with a dummy listener.
close_reason: Added signal parsing tests and JSON output for kill; clarified README usage

title: MVP: document no-daemon scope and port semantics
description: Write concise docs explaining MVP scope (no daemon), what 'busy' means (LISTENing sockets), and why TIME_WAIT isn't something we 'clean up'. Reference REVIEW_CODEX.md as the rationale.
acceptance_criteria: Docs explain LISTEN vs TIME_WAIT; docs state wrapper is best-effort; docs list safety defaults for kill.
close_reason: Documented MVP scope and port semantics in MVP_SCOPE.md

title: MVP: harden ss parsing + document Linux requirements
description: Improve `ss -ltnpH` parsing to handle common formats and permissions limitations (missing process info without sudo). Document what fields may be blank on Linux.
acceptance_criteria: Unit tests cover sample ss output; docs explain when PID/command may be empty.
close_reason: Hardened ss parsing, added tests, and documented Linux PID/command limits

title: MVP: harden lsof parsing + add fixtures
description: Make `internal/scan/lsof.go` robust against macOS/Linux variants (IPv6 tokens, extra fields, multiple listeners). Add test fixtures and unit tests for parsing tokens â†’ port/address/pid.
acceptance_criteria: Unit tests cover representative lsof output; `freeport list` and `who` behave consistently on macOS.
close_reason: Hardened lsof parsing and added fixtures/tests
